page.title: 05Crookhey Hall,Cockerham
page.content: This impressive Victorian mansion stands in seventeen acres of gardens and woods, and is in the heart of the best of Lancashire's countryside. It was designed by Alfred Waterhouse for Colonel Bird the local Squire and his wife. They lived in it until the Colonel's death in l909. Subsequently it was let to the Henrique family, the Carrington family and eventually to Liverpool Corporation in l940 as an evacuation centre"for 29 M.D. pupils". It is now a residential School for children with special needs. Crookhey was recently designated a listed building, and the craftmanship of both wood and stone fully justify this inclusion. The number of pupils in residence has fallen over the years and closure was mooted. However,as there are few schools of this type, sanity prevailed and it was reprieved.
